title: Manchester misery, Figo in Guildford and lads, it's Tottenham – Football Weekly
text:
Max Rushden , Barry Glendenning , Jonathan Wilson and Barney Ronay discuss crises abound at Spurs, Everton and both Manchester clubs, while Sid Lowe and Nicky Bandini are on the line to talk La Liga and Serie A

Join the conversation on Facebook, Twitter and email.

We take a look back at the weekend’s football, starting with Wolves’ 2-0 win at the home of the champions, Manchester City, which allowed Liverpool to go eight points clear at the top with a late win over Leicester.

Spurs and Manchester United also lost games they weren’t meant to, going down at Brighton and Newcastle respectively.

We cover the rest of the Premier League, round up the Football League, talk Phil Neville’s strife and (whisper it) the hint of a title race in Scotland.

We speak to Sid Lowe in Spain about Barcelona’s thumping, but flattering, 4-0 win over Sevilla, and Nicky Bandini WhatsApps her Serie A round-up.

Back on Thursday!



PS: Football Weekly versus Science is sold out!

PPS: our Christmas special is the last opportunity to see Football Weekly Live in London this year, at Indigo at the O2. Max, Barry, Jonathan Wilson, Elis James - more info and tickets here.

PPPS: we are also returning to Leeds in December – Max and Lars plus two TBA, click here.

PPPPS: if you’re on the other side of the Irish Sea, come and see us in Dublin! Max and Barry plus two more TBA, more details to be found here.
description: Max Rushden, Barry Glendenning, Jonathan Wilson and Barney Ronay discuss crises abound at Spurs, Everton and both Manchester clubs, while Sid Lowe and Nicky Bandini are on the line to talk La Liga and Serie A
